name: GJ 3512
scenarioDescription:
The GJ 3512 Exoplanetary System


Overview

GJ 3512 is a star with 0.12 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.14 times its radius. It is located 30.95 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 5.5 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

GJ 3512 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the GJ 3512 system


GJ 3512 b

GJ 3512 b was discovered by the Calar Alto Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.34 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 3512 b is 147.234 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, GJ 3512 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system GJ 3512, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Calar Alto Observatory.
